name: Snake (C++ & SFML)
description:
Snake made with C++ and SFML

Controls:

  • WASD -> Move
  • R -> Restart (during game over screen) 

Win10 64-bit OS Only 

(Sorry about this, didn't realize I downloaded the 64 bit version SFML until later and didn't want to mess up my VS configuration :/)

You might be thinking wait... wut... he already make snake. And you would be correct. Good on you for noticing that! :) 

You might have also noticed that in the other version (i.e. the Unity version), I said it was the baseline for making the same game in C++...well here is that version.

I didn't track my hours like I did the Unity version due to the C++ tutorials, SFML tutorials and trying to figure out texture work in SFML...*sigh*...took around 3 days off and on. If I had to guess-imate, how long it took me, I would say between 20 -30 hrs. 

Did it take longer the expected? Yes. 

Did I learn along the way? Yes, I learn a ton. 

Was it fun to build? Absolutely!

Will I make more games? Yes, stay tuned.

Will I make snake again? No. I think I am done for now. ;)

Nonetheless, I wanted to share the result of my efforts with you in the form of this version of Snake.

If you would like more details of my development, source code, advice, or help about anything related to game dev or programming, let me know in the comments or by reaching out on discord at aaron7eleven#3339. I am open book and would love to chat about games.

Thanks for reading this minor monologue. It really means alot. I hope you enjoy the game.

Don't forget...you're awesome! :)
